isis.stitle: ALTERNATOR: DELCO-REMY 27-SI SERIES, TYPE 200 - TROUBLESHOOTING - OVERCHARGED BATTERY

svcproc.title: OVERCHARGED BATTERY
svcproc.para: The following checks must be performed before removing the alternator from the vehicle.

important.para: Remember that an overheated battery will be overcharged even though no charging circuit defects are present.

step1.para: If battery is not defective or overheated, connect a voltmeter between alternator "BAT" terminal and ground.
With all accessories turned off, increase engine speed as required to obtain maximum voltage reading.

If voltage is 15.5 volts or more on a 12-volt system, or 31 volts or more on a 24-volt system, remove alternator from repair as covered in REPAIR PROCEDURES
.
On models having voltage adjustment cap, if voltage does not exceed the value listed in Step 3 above, then adjust the voltage to a lower value. To adjust voltage:

step2.para: Lower the setting by removing the voltage adjusting cap, rotating it in increments of 90 degrees and then reinserting the cap in the connector body.

The cap is set for medium high voltage ( Figure 3). Setting the cap (aligning the arrow) at position 2 results with a medium low regulator setting. Position "LO" is the low setting and position "HI" is the highest regulator setting.
After adjusting the setting check for an improved battery condition after a service period of reasonable length, such as one week.

important.para: The voltage adjustment in Figure 3 is for purposes of illustration only. The actual adjustment may be in some other position, depending on the application requirements.
